str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Galilean, an inhabitant of Galilee. From Galilaia; Galilean or belonging to Galilea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A festival, feast, periodically recurring. Of uncertain affinity; a festival.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
A festival, feast, periodically recurring. Of uncertain affinity; a festival.
And, even, also, namely.
